LanguageData.AM.Grapple.FloatMenu.Tip: Use a lasso to pull {1} towards {0}.\nThis does not harm {1}.
LanguageData.AM.Grapple.FloatMenu.TipEnemy: Use a lasso to pull {1} towards {0}.\nThis does not harm {1}, but it does put them into melee/execution range.
LanguageData.AM.Exec.FloatMenu.Tip: Perform an execution animation on {1}.\nPossible outcomes based on weapon, melee skill, armor, mod settings etc:\n{2}
LanguageData.AM.Error.Duel.MissingWeapon: {Pawn} does not have a valid melee weapon
LanguageData.AM.Error.Duel.NoAnim: The weapon(s) these pawns are carrying cannot be used to duel with.
LanguageData.AM.Error.Duel.NoAnim.Short: These melee weapons cannot be used to duel
LanguageData.AM.Error.Duel.NoPath: {0} cannot reach {1} to start a duel
LanguageData.AM.Error.Duel.WaitedTooLong: {0} got tired of waiting for {1} to arrive to their duel, and called it off.
LanguageData.AM.Gizmos.DuelSpot.StartDuel.Label: Start duel
LanguageData.AM.Gizmos.DuelSpot.StartDuel.Desc: Manually start a duel between two friendly pawns with valid weapons. Prisoners cannot participate.\n\nThis is a friendly duel, nobody will be hurt.
LanguageData.AM.Gizmos.DuelSpot.StartDuel.InUse: The duel spot is currently in use
LanguageData.AM.Gizmos.DuelSpot.StartDuel.MissingWeap: {0} does not have a valid melee weapon (must be long weapon, not short)
LanguageData.AM.Gizmos.DuelSpot.StartDuel.IncompatWea: {0}'s weapon cannot be used to duel {1}, their weapons are incompatible (must be long weapons, not short)
LanguageData.AM.Gizmos.DuelSpot.StartDuel.OnCooldown: {0} cannot do a friendly duel for another {2} seconds
LanguageData.AM.Gizmos.DuelSpot.StartDuel.FailedToSta: An unexpected error caused the duel to not be able to be started. Please send logs to the mod author.
LanguageData.AM.Gizmos.DuelSpot.ToggleVisibility.Desc: Makes this duel spot invisible, or shows it again.\nWarning: it really is invisible! Don't forget where you put it down or you may struggle to find it again...
LanguageData.AM.Error.Exec.DownedTarget: {Target} is downed. Downed pawns cannot be executed.
LanguageData.AM.Error.Exec.CannotFist: {Exec} has no weapon and cannot use their fists: {Additional}
LanguageData.AM.Error.Exec.NoWalk: {Target} is not adjacent to {Exec}, and cannot be lassoed or walked to.
LanguageData.AM.Error.Exec.NoWeapon: {Exec} is not wielding a valid melee weapon
LanguageData.AM.Error.Exec.NoAnims: {Exec} cannot perform any execution animations using their {Weapon}.\nThis is probably due to a lack of melee skill or because all animations are disabled in the mod settings.
LanguageData.AM.Error.Exec.NoSpace: There is not enough space to perform any execution animation here
LanguageData.AM.Error.Exec.NoPath: {Exec} cannot reach {Target} by walking, and their lasso is unavailable or unusable.
LanguageData.AM.Error.Exec.BadFists.Short: Cannot use their fists for execution
LanguageData.AM.Error.Grapple.TooFar: {Target} is out of reach of {Grappler}'s lasso
LanguageData.AM.Error.Grapple.Mass: {Target} is too heavy for {Grappler} to lasso
LanguageData.AM.Error.Grapple.Size: {Target} is too large for {Grappler} to lasso
LanguageData.AM.Error.Grapple.SkillIssue: {Grappler} does not have the required melee skill ({MeleeSkill}) to use their lasso
LanguageData.AM.Error.Grapple.Manipulation: {Grappler} does not have the required manipulation to use their lasso
LanguageData.AM.Error.Grapple.NoDest: There is no free spot around {Grappler} to drag {Target} to
LanguageData.AM.Stats.FriendlyCoef: Friendly Pawn Multiplier (from mod settings): x{0}
LanguageData.AM.Stats.EnemyCoef: Hostile Pawn Multiplier (from mod settings): x{0}
LanguageData.AM.Skill.OnCooldownExec: On cooldown for {0} seconds (because of recent execution).
LanguageData.AM.Skill.Gilgamesh.LowPsy: Psylink level {0} is below required level {1}.
LanguageData.AM.Skill.Gilgamesh.LowMelee: Melee level {0} is below required level {1}.
LanguageData.AM.Patch.OptDisabled: The invisibilty optimization has been disabled by the Melee Animation mod due to visual bugs.
LanguageData.SimpleSettings.ClickToReset: Right-click to set an option back to its default value.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Presets.Default.Desc: Enables all features the mod has to offer
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Presets.NoLassos.Desc:
Everything is enabled except lassos. You can still craft and use lassos manually if you want but enemies will not spawn with or use lassos.
* Adds melee attack animations. * Adds melee weapon idle animations * Adds duels * Adds execution animations * Adds Unique Skills
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Presets.VanillaPlus.Desc:
Keeps things very close to vanilla combat. Your pawns will not use lassos unless you manually instruct them to. Your pawns can not do executions, ever. Enemies will never do executions or use lassos.
* Adds melee attack animations. * Adds melee weapon idle animations * Lassos can be used by friendly pawns, but must be equipped and triggered manually.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.AnimateAtIdle.Des: If enabled, melee weapons are animated whenever they are held, such as when standing drafted or while moving in combat. If disabled, animations are limited to duels, special skills and executions. Leaving this enabled can have a large performance impact on densely populated maps. Please reload your save after changing this setting.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.EnableUniqueSkill: Enables or disables the Unique Skill system. Unique Skills are powerful attacks or abilities that are unlocked under certain conditions. Only your colonists can use these skills and they must be activated manually. See the Steam workshop page for more info.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.AllowInvisiblePaw: When in an animation, such as an execution, pawns are considered invisible by all other pawns and turrets: they will not be actively targeted or shot at. This makes executions less risky. Note that pawns in animations can still take damage, such as from stray gunfire or explosions.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.GlobalAnimationSp: A modifier on the speed of all animations. Higher is faster.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.AutoGrapple.Desc: If true, your colonists will automatically use their lassos against enemies. This only changes the default setting. It can also be configured on a per-pawn basis.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.GrappleAttemptMTB: This is the average time, in seconds, at which friendly pawns will attempt to use their lasso to pull an enemy into melee range. If their execution is off cooldown and Auto Execute is enabled, they will immediately execute the lassoed target too.
This is the % chance for any melee fighter pawn to spawn with a lasso equipped. Set this to 0% to disable natural lasso generation on pawns.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.EnemiesCanGrapple: Can enemies use lassos (if they have any) to pull your colonists into melee range?
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.GrappleAttemptMTB: This is the average time, in seconds, at which enemy pawns will attempt to use their lasso to pull a target into melee range. If their execution is off cooldown and 'Enemies Can Perform Executions' is enabled, they will immediately execute the lassoed target too.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.MinMeleeSkillToLa: The minumum melee skill required to use a lasso. Affects all pawns.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.MinManipulationTo: The minimum Manipulation stat required to use a lasso. Affects all pawns.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.MaxLassoMass.Desc: The maximum mass that a pawn can have in order for it to be lassoed. The mass is measured in kilograms. You can check the mass of pawns in their Stat sheet. Set to zero to disable the mass limit.
The maximum 'body size' that a pawn can have in order for it to be lassoed. For reference, here are some example body sizes: • Chicken: 0.3 • Human: 1 • Boomalope: 2 • Warg: 3 • Thrumbo: 4
Set to zero to disable the body size limit.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.GrappleSpeed.Desc: Adjusts the speed (not cooldown) of lassos, making it faster or slower to ensnare and pull in an enemy. Higher values make the lasso faster. Affects all pawns.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.MaxFillPctForLass: Max Building Fill For Lasso Drag

The maximum 'fill' percentage of a building that a pawn can be dragged through by a lasso. Lower values mean that pawns can not be dragged through/over partial cover such as sand bags or embrasures. A value of 100% means that the lasso can pull pawns though/over anything except completely solid walls and buildings.
Entirely enables or disables the execution system. Disabling this means that no pawns will every be able to do executions, and the option is removed from the UI.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.AutoExecute.Desc: If true, your pawns will automatically execute enemy pawns in combat, without your input. This may include opportunistically using their grappling hooks if the Auto Grapple setting is enabled. This only changes the default setting. It can also be configured on a per-pawn basis.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.ExecuteAttemptMTB:
This is the average time, in seconds, at which friendly pawns will attempt to start an execution animation on the enemy they are currently fighting. For example, if this is set to 5 and your pawn is fighting in melee, an execution animation will be triggered on average after 5 seconds. This does not affect execution cooldown, which is a pawn-specific stat.
Lower values can greatly impact performance on populated maps.

This is the average time, in seconds, at which enemy pawns will attempt to start an execution animation on the target they are currently fighting. For example, if this is set to 5 and an enemy is fighting in melee, an execution animation will be triggered on average after 5 seconds. This does not affect execution cooldown, which is a pawn-specific stat.
Lower values can greatly impact performance on populated maps.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.AnimalsCanBeExecu: Allows animals to be executed. You are a bad person if you enable this.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.ExecutionLethalit: A general modifier on the lethality of execution animations. Higher values make executions more lethal. Affects all pawns.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.ExecutionsOnFrien: Executions Are Non Lethal On Friendlies

If enabled, execution animations on friendly pawns are always non-lethal regardless of other settings. Prisoners and slaves are considered friendly.
Useful when trying to stop a mental break or prisoner uprising without causing a bloodbath.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.ExecutionArmorCoe: A multiplier on the effectiveness of armor when calculating execution animation outcome. Lower values decrease the effect of armor on the outcome, higher values increase the strength of armor. Set to 0% to make armor be ignored.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.ExecutionsCanDest: If true, executions can destroy specific vital body parts, such as the heart or head. If false, the pawn is simply killed by 'magic' (no specific part takes damage) Note: if disabled, combat log generation does not work properly for the execution, and will give a default message: "name was killed."
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.MeleeSkillExecCoo:
The amount that melee skill affects execution cooldown time. Higher melee skill means lower cooldown, changing this value increases or decreases the effect of melee skill. Set to 0% to disable melee skill as a factor.
Note: only affects friendly pawns.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.FriendlyExecCoold: This adjust the execution cooldown time for friendly pawns. Lower values decrease the cooldown. You can see the final cooldown time in the pawn's stats.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.EnemyExecCooldown: This adjust the execution cooldown time for hostile pawns. Lower values decrease the cooldown. You can see the final cooldown time in the pawn's stats.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.MinDuelDuration.D: The minimum number of attacks in a duel. Just affects the duration of the animation, has no impact on the outcome of the duel.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.MaxDuelDuration.D: The maximum number of attacks in a duel. Just affects the duration of the animation, has no impact on the outcome of the duel.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.FriendlyDuelCoold: The cooldown time, in seconds, after a friendly duel where a friendly duel cannot be started again.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.ShowHands.Desc: Should pawn hands be displayed holding melee weapons?
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.Gore_DamageEffect: Enable or disable the damage affect in animations. The damage effect is normally a small, temporary puff of blood.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.Gore_FloorBlood.D: Enable or disable the spawning of blood in animations. The blood is filth that must be cleaned up. Includes modded blood and mechanoid blood (oil).
In order for the animation to transition seamlessly to regular gameplay, execution animations leave the corpse of the victim in non-vanilla positions and rotations. This offset can be confusing however, because the corpse no longer occupies the center of the tile. Note: The offset corpses are reset after a save-reload.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.MoveAnimSpeedCoef: Changes the speed of the movement animations. Higher values increase the speed. This is just a visual change, it obviously doesn't change the pawn's movement speed.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.SpeedUpAttackAnim: Increase Animation Speed When Attacks Are Fast

If enabled, the speed of melee attack animations will be automatically increased to match the pawn's melee speed. If false, the attack animation speed will never change however the animation may be interrupted by the next attack animation starting before the last one ended. This is a purely visual change and does not affect combat.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.FlavourMTB.Desc: Pawns standing with their weapon out (such as when drafted) will sometimes play an animation where they swing their weapon about, flourish it etc. This option controls the average time, in seconds, between the occurrence of this animation. Set to 0 to disable the animations entirely.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.AttackPauseDurati: When doing a regular melee attack, the animation will very briefly pause at the point when the weapon intersects the target. This lets you know whether an attack connected, as well as giving the hit a bit more visual oomph. This setting changes the duration of that pause, or disables it entirely. This is a purely visual change and does not affect combat.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.TrailColor.Desc: The base color of weapon trails. If you set the alpha to 0, trails will be disabled.
A multiplier on the length of weapon trails. If 0%, trails are disabled.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.DrawNamesInAnimat: If true, the name of pawns is drawn below them, just like in the base game. If false, the name is not drawn, for a more cinematic animation.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.ShowExecutionMote: Enables or disables the text popup that shows the outcome of an execution (i.e. injure, down or kill) when an execution animation plays.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.MaxProcessingThre: The maximum number of CPU threads to use when processing pawns for automatic executions & lasso usage. If set to 0, the thread count is automatically determined based on your CPU, and if set to 1 then multi-threaded processing is disabled. Set to 1 if you experience error spam caused by a mod conflict, although it will decrease performance considerably.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.MultithreadedMatr: When enabled, multiple CPU threads are used to calculate complex matrix transformation needed for animations. The number of threads is given by the Max Processing Threads setting.
When enabled, offscreen animations are not drawn to save time and increase FPS. This option is only here in case there are unexpected bugs related to this culling.
The number of ticks between scanning all pawns on the map for automatic execution/duel/lasso opportunities. Higher values can increase FPS at the cost of less responsiveness.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.FriendlyPawnLetha: Positive values act as a lethality bonus for friendly pawns (including slaves) in execution & duel outcomes, meaning that they will be lethal more often.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.FriendlyPawnDuelB: Positive values act as a duel ability bonus for friendly pawns (including slaves), meaning that they will win duels more often.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.NormalDist.Desc:
Higher values make duel outcomes less dependent on duel ability and more on randomness, lower values make the outcome more dependent on duel ability and less on randomness.
Technical: This is the standard deviation used in the duel outcome normal distribution curve.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.WarnOfFriendlyExe: Prevents you from accidentally executing a friendly pawn by requiring you to hold the [Shift] key when selecting a friendly pawn for execution.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.SendStatistics.De: When a mod is missing a patch (that allows the melee weapons to do animations), the ID of said mod is anonymously logged to let this mod's author know that a patch is needed. The only information logged is: mod ID, mod name, weapon count. You can opt out of this functionality by disabling this option. Note: logging does not occur the first time you run the game with this mod.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.ChanceToFailMinSk: The chance that an execution attempt will result in failure, stunning the attacking pawn and leaving them vulnerable for a short time. This is the chance when a pawn has 0 melee skill. Affects all pawns.
LanguageData.AM.AMSettings.Settings.ChanceToFailMaxSk: The chance that an execution attempt will result in failure, stunning the attacking pawn and leaving them vulnerable for a short time. This is the chance when a pawn has 20 melee skill. Affects all pawns.
